name: Sore Throat
description: A sore throat is pain, scratchiness, or irritation of the throat that often worsens when swallowing. It is commonly caused by viral infections, cold, or throat irritation.

mild.definition: Mild throat irritation with short duration and no danger signs

high_risk.definition: Severe throat pain or throat pain with danger signs

criteria.other_symptoms: difficulty swallowing, breathing difficulty, high fever

self_care: Drink warm fluids like tea or soup
Use a humidifier to moisten the air
Rest your voice and stay hydrated

medicines.name: Paracetamol 500mg Tablet
medicines.used_for: Relief of throat pain and mild fever
medicines.dose: Adults: 500–1000 mg every 6 hours (Maximum 4000 mg in 24 hours)

medicines.name: Lozenges (e.g., Amylmetacresol + Dichlorobenzyl Alcohol)
medicines.dose: Adults: Dissolve one lozenge slowly in mouth every 2–3 hours as needed

urgent: sore throat lasting more than 7 days
doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if sore throat is severe, persistent beyond one week, or associated with breathing difficulty, difficulty swallowing, or high fever.

assessment_questions.question: How severe is your sore throat?
How many days have you had this sore throat?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek urgent medical care if symptoms are severe or worsening.
